My own beliefs, my personal beliefs, I came into being during the most traumatic moment in American history, the Great American Depression in the 1930s.
I was 17 at the time, and I saw on the sidewalks pots and pans and bedsteads and mattresses.

The individual discovers his strength as an individual because, along the way, discovered others share his feelings.

It's always been there.
